fields_of_interest: Economy, finance and the euro, Energy, Regional Policy, Transport, Climate Action, Banking and financial services
eu_initiatives:
Key focus areas for 2018: 
•    Global climate process and implementation of the Paris Agreement 
•    G20 & G7 green finance work 
•    Measures complimentary to the ETS to support decarbonisation of the power sector 
•    CO2 from Cars & Vans regulation 
•    Clean Energy Package 
•    EU Sustainable Finance 
•    2050 Roadmap
subsection: Non-governmental organisations, platforms and networks and similar

relevant_communication:
IIGCC has produced the following publications in 2017 and in the beginning of this year: 
 
- IIGCC letter to EU Energy Ministers 4 December 2017 – See more at: http://www.iigcc.org/files/publication-files/171218_RES_Governance_letter_to_Ministers.pdf  
 
- IIGCC joins leading energy efficiency and renewables business groups to write to EU decision-makers – See more at: http://www.iigcc.org/files/publication-files/RES_EE_INV_Joint_Statement_Gov.pdf 
 
- Aligning Europe’s financial system with the Paris Agreement - See more at: http://www.iigcc.org/files/publication-files/IIGCC_2017_EU_Position_Paper.PDF  
 
- IIGCC Autos letter to EU policy makers - See more at: 
http://www.iigcc.org/files/publication-files/1709_CO2_from_Cars_Vans_-_letter.pdf 
 
- IIGCC joins leading business groups to write to UK Govt - See more at: http://www.iigcc.org/files/publication-files/Letter_from_leading_business_and_investor_associations_to_the_Prime_Minister.pdf 
 
- IIGCC letter to EU Energy Ministers 22 June 2017 - See more at: http://www.iigcc.org/files/publication-files/IIGCC_Letter_to_EU_Energy_Ministers_22.06.2017.pdf 
 
- IIGCC Letter to EU Energy Policy Makers 24 May 2017 - See more at: http://www.iigcc.org/files/publication-files/IIGCC_Letter_to_EU_Energy_Policymakers_23_May_2017_FINAL_PDF.pdf 
 
- An Investable Emissions Reduction Plan - See more at: http://www.iigcc.org/files/publication-files/IIGCC_2017_UK_Policy_Report_WEB_SMALL.PDF  
 
- Investment fit for the future - input for the G20 during the 2017 Germany Presidency - See more at: http://www.iigcc.org/files/publication-files/IIGCC_policy_messages_relevant_to_2017_G20.PDF  
 
 - IIGCC response to the TCFD consultation 10th February 2017 -See more at: http://www.iigcc.org/files/publication-files/IIGCC_Response_to_the_TCFD_Consultation_10.02.17_v4.pdf
goals__remit:
The Institutional Investors Group on Climate Change (IIGCC) is a forum for collaboration on climate change for European investors. It provides investors with the collaborative platform to encourage public policies, investment practices and corporate behaviour that address long-term risks and opportunities associated with climate change and the transition to a low-carbon economy.   
 
IIGCC currently has over 150 members, including some of the largest pension funds and asset managers in Europe, representing around €21 trillion in assets. 
IIGCC pursues its mission through two strategic objectives: 
•             To change policy signals by encouraging the adoption and effective implementation of strong and credible public policy solutions that ensure an orderly and efficient move to a low carbon economy as well as measures for adaptation.  
•             To inform investment and ownership practices to preserve and enhance long-term investment values.
